questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about ………..
questionsData.article: A volcano is an opening in Earth's crust. Volcanoes can change Earth's surface in just a few minutes. Melted rocks and hot gases (erupt 1) through this opening. These materials create a landform when they pile up around the opening. Where Earth's crust is weak, liquid rock may push its way to the surface and erupt as lava. Lava is hot, melted rock that comes from a volcano. Some lava coming from a volcano is thick and moves slowly. Thick lava usually shoots out of the top of volcanoes. This lava can build tall mountains layer by layer. Lava can also be thin. Thin lava moves quickly. It can cover large areas of land before it cools and hardens new rocks. Lava deserts have been formed from lava that moves quickly. Volcanoes can be very dangerous, (they 3) often (destroy 2) what is near them, but they can also create new landforms.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about ……….
questionsData.article: Sometime the best medicine is no medicine. It’s what doctors call a (placebo), Aplacebo doesn’t have any real medical effect, It may be just a sugar pill, But when a doctor gives a patient a placebo, it often helps. The effect of a placebo is both, psychological and physical. In fact, beliefs and feelings can have physical effects on yourbody, Sometimes it’s hard ta understand how a placebo works, Alot depends on the doctor and the way he or she talks to you. If the doctor seems very certain and uses a serious voice, the placebo is morelikely to help, and what helps is that there are two big adventages to placebo. First it has no side effects and second it is inexpensive. There are many reasons for doctors to use placebo, However, some doctors have doubts about how well a placebo really works. These doctors prefer to give real medicine. They don’t want to tell lies to their patients. Infact, the placebo’s effect only works if the doctor tells a lie. If the patient finds out the truth, how can he or she trust the doctor in the future?

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about …………….
questionsData.article: Flu, short for influenza, is a virus (that 3) passes easily from person to person. Every year, millions of people (miss 1) work and school because of the seasonal flu. Seasonal flu exists worldwide. Usually the flu season is in the winter months, but in warm climates, the flu occurs during the rainy season. Flu symptoms include fever,cough, sore throat, body aches, headaches, chills and fatigue. These symptoms usually show up quickly, developing within three to six hours of exposure to the virus. With the flu, you may start the day feeling fine, only to end up feeling (terrible 2) a few hours later. The flu is especially dangerous for children aged two and under, adults over 65 years old, and people in poor health. These people may not be able to fight the virus and can become extremely sick. Therefore, scientists must develop new vaccines each year. It can take six months to a year to develop these vaccines. For some viruses, there is no vaccine, and flu is one of these viruses.

These gases make up less than one percent of air, air has a lot of power, it takes up space, On the surface of Earth, we are at the bottom of a layer of air. The weight of air pushing own on Earth's surface helps create air pressure, When there is less air around you, less pressure is felt, This is a low-pressure area, Cold air helps create high-pressure areas. It is also a big factor in wind and weather, When there is a difference in air reassure, air is moved, The movement of air is wind, Air pressure and wind affect the weather. Storms develop when there are rapid changes in temperature and air pressure, Hurricanes, thunderstorms, and gentle breezes are all caused by wind and changes air pressure. Air is odorless; we can't smell it. It is also tasteless and invisible Without air, people and other living organism couldn't survive, Air allows plants and animals to exchange the oxygen and carbon dioxide that all living things need to survive.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about ………
questionsData.article: If you are in (strong 1) pain, nothing else matters. Pain of a tooth can dominate all other sensations. Sometimes people who suffer from constant or frequent pain, the experience is unbearable and can sometimes even lead to suicide. Pain is also part of the way your body respond to conditions that could damage (it 3). Unlike other sensations, pain can arise from various kinds of causes, such as a very loud sound, a heavy pressure, a knife wound, or an extremely bright light. Pain serves as an (essential 2) defense signal that warns us of potential harm, and tells us to get treatment for illness and injury. Many people can learn to control pain by psychological techniques, such as hypnosis or deep relaxation. Others find relief by taking a placebo, a fake drug given in the place of real drugs. Its effectiveness, of course, depends on the person believing that they are getting real medicine. Apparently, the expectation of pain relief is enough to cause the brain to release its own painkilling substances.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about?
questionsData.article: Gravity is the attraction between two objects, Every object on Earth is attracted toward the center of Earth. Gravity is what keeps us on the ground, Without it, we would drift into space. The force between Earth and you is greater than the force between the moon and you, You would weigh less on the moon, because the moon has less mass than Earth has. The moon is attracted toward Earth. The force that exists between Earth and the moon is gravitational attraction. This force keeps the moon orbiting Earth. The moon revolves around Earth. Isaac Newton was the first person to explain the effect of gravity upon our universe, He used mathematical formula to prove that gravity is what keeps the planets in orbit, Since Newton's discoveries, we have learned a great deal about the effects of gravity. We know that, because of gravity, the moon orbits Earth. And also because of gravity, Earth revolves around the sun. gravity affects all the planets in the solar system as well as the sun.

questionsData.title: …..The adult camel approximately weighs
questionsData.article: Camels belong to the same family as Ilamas, alpacas and guanaces. However, camels are distinguished from Ilamas, which are larger than alpacas, by their largest size. There are two types of camels: the Arabian camel, or dromedary, which has a single hump, and the Bactrian, or Asian camel, which has two humps on its back. The Arabian camel lives mainly in the Middle East, Africa and India, whereas the Bactrian lives in the high lands of central Asia. Camels stand on four flat feet, each foot has two hoofed toes. An adult camel weighs 650 kg and about 2 meters tall. The hump, which is made of fat is used to store water and food.

questionsData.title: Some bats have a strong sense of…..
questionsData.article: Bats are classified as mammals because they give birth rather than laying eggs. They sleep in the day and fly at night. They have long fingers and stretched wings. The bat's wing looks like the human hand. Almost 1000 bat kinds can be found worldwide. Bats can be found anywhere in the world except the polar regions and deserts. However, the number ofsome bats are dangerously low or in decline. About 70% of bats eat insects. There are also fruit-eating bats, and the blood-sucking bats of South America. Some bats have a strong sense of hearing, they emit sounds that reflect off objects in their path, called echoes. From echoes of the sounds they emit, bats can determine the size of objects, how far away they are and how fast they are flying, all in a split of a second .

questionsData.article:
Tea is an aromatic beverage. It is made from the leaves of Camellia. It is classified into five main types: Black,
Green, Oolong, White, and Puerth. Black tea is historically the most (common 1) in the western world. Green tea
may (benefit 2) the heart. Tea is popular in countries around the world. In history, tea drinking was important part
of customs in some countries. There were different customs for drinking tea. In Britain, the British like a nice cup
at half past seven in the morning, their idea of heaven is a nice cup of tea. In China and Japan, tea was first used as
a medicine. Years later, they started to take it as a daily drink. There are many interesting tea customs that have
developed over the countries. For example, people in Japan serve green tea in small cups, however British prefer
black tea. In India, people might drink tea with milk and sugar. In Morocco, people drink tea with sugar and mint.
Tea may no longer be considered as cure for all illnesses, but ( it 3) is a remedy for both the body and the spirit in
our life.

questionsData.title: Alpacas live mainly in……
questionsData.article: Alpacas, south American mammals, are in same family as camels, llamas,vicunas and guanacos. However,alpacas and llamas  are closely related and they can successfully crossbreed. Alpacas are distinguished from llamas by their smaller size . The aplaca also differs from the llama in having a rounded body and in its shaggy fiber coat,  which differs from  camal's  hair and llama's wool covering. An adult alpaca stands approximately 90 cm (35 inches ) high and weighs 65 kg ( 121 pounds ). The fiber of the alpaca is used for making a wide variety of textiles. Alpacas are expert spitters, when they feel threatened, they spit slimy saliva, which is the acidic stomach contains, and project it onto the chosentarget.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about ………………….
questionsData.article: Tears usually show how you feel. When you're unhappy, tears roll down on your cheeks, Sometime tears drop from your eyes when you are happy, or if you laugh very hard. But tears have a more important job than showing how you feel. All day long your eyes sit in a bath of tears. These tears keep your eyes clean and healthy. They wash away dirt and germs and other things that get into your eyes. Your eyes also need tears to keep them wet. Your eyes must be wet so that they can move smoothly. If they didn’t move smoothly, you'd have to turn your head to look at things that weren't right in front of you. If you didn’t have tears, your eyes couldn't move and soon you would be blind. Under each eyelid are tiny sacs called tear glands. That's where tears are made, Generally your eyes can’t do without tears. All day long tears wash your eyes to keep them

questionsData.article: The first migrations in human history was probably voluntary. People choose to leave their birthplace in search of food, water, or living space. The second kind of migration has been involuntary, which means that people were forced to travel. Between the 16th and 19th centuries, for instance, European slave traders (kidnapped 1) an immense number of African natives and transported them against their will to the Americas. There, the Africans encountered a world unlike anything (they 3) had ever seen in their native lands. They were forced to work in terrible conditions, and many died young. The practice of slavery declined in the 18th and the 19th centuries. Subsequently, it was made (illegal 2), and the descanters of those early African slaves became free. Africans were absorbed into the cultures of the Americans, and today they are described, for example, as African Americans, Afro-Caribbean, or Afro-Latin Americans. In recent years, DNA researchers linked the DNA of all humans on our planet with the DNA of African natives. The European slave traders probably would have found it incredible to think that people all over the world were, in sense, related to each other.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about …………….
questionsData.article: Colors affect everyone. We think carefully about color when we choose our clothes or select paint fora roam. But we are often Unaware of how color affect us. Colors in nature have universal meaning, For example, trees and plants are green, so the color green represents life and nature, Blue, the color of the sky, oceans and lakes make us think of air, water and peace, Colors red, yellow, orange, blue, green and purple in spectrum may give us feelings of warmth and comfort or feelings of anger, They often give us a feeling of calmness or sadness, Humans have known about the power of colors for a long time. Ancient cultures in China, Egypt and India use colors to heal sickness, People believe that each color had a healing power, For example, blue decreases pain. The researchers are finding that colors affect our emotions and can change our behavior in specific ways. Colors can affect how people think, feel and act.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about………. styles.
questionsData.article: Our minds and bodies (gather 1) information in different ways and from all around us: seeing, hearing and doing. Then our brain process that information, organize (it 3) and make connections to things we already know. This process can also work in different ways: Do we think in pictures or words? Do we (remember 2) details or big pictures? When we are trying to learn, it helps to know how our brain works. How do we best gather and organize information? Different people have different learning styles. For example, one person might struggle with written information but understand it immediately in an illustration. Another person might have problems with the pictures, but not the written text. Psychologists have identified some basic learning styles. Linguistics, learning by using language skills. Visual learning by seeing what they are learning. Interpersonal, learning by working with others. Intrapersonal, learning by associating new information directly with experience. Kinesthetic, learning by movement and physical activities. Eventually, you will often experience situations that do not match your learning  style. If you know what your strengths are, you can develop your own learning style to balance your weakness for a more successful experience.

questionsData.article: Air is a mixture of invisible gases, mainly oxygen and nitrogen, that surrounds Earth, It is about one-fifth oxygen and four nitrogen, There are small amounts of water vapor and carbon dioxide in the air. These gases make up less than one percent of air, air has a lot of power, it takes up space, On the surface of Earth, we are at the bottom of a layer of air. The weight of air pushing own on Earth's surface helps create air pressure, When there is less air around you, less pressure is felt, This is a low-pressure areas, Cold air helps create high-pressure areas. It is also a big factor in wind and weather, When there is a difference in air reassure, air is moved, The movement of air is wind, Air pressure and wind affect the weather. Storms develop when there are rapid changes in temperature and air pressure, Hurricanes, thunderstorms, and gentle breezes are all caused by wind and changes air pressure. Air is odorless; we can't smell it. It is also tasteless and invisible Without air, people and other living organism couldn't survive, Air allows plants and animals to exchange the oxygen and carbon dioxide that all living things need to survive.

These gases make up less than one percent of air, air has a lot of power, it takes up space, On the surface of Earth, we are at the bottom of a layer of air. The weight of air pushing own on Earth's surface helps create air pressure, When there is less air around you, less pressure is felt, This is a low-pressure areas, Cold air helps create high-pressure areas. Storms develop when there are rapid changes in temperature and air pressure, Hurricanes, thunderstorms, and gentle breezes are all caused by wind and changes air pressure. questionsData.title: How long did it take the horses to be ill ?
questionsData.article: In September 1994, a violent disease erupted among a group of race horses in a small town in Australia. The first victim was a female horse that was last seen eating grass beneath a fruit tree. One of her caretakers brought the animal back to her stable for observation, but the horse died two days later. Within two weeks, most of the other horses in the stable become ill as well. Despite the efforts by the veterinarian, 12more animals died. Laboratory analysis finally discovered the root of the problem: the horses had been infected by a previously unknown virus which doctors eventually labeled Hendra. This virus had originated in bats that lived in the tree where the first horse had been eating grass. The virus passed from the bats to the horse, which then transmitted the virus to other horses with disastrous results.

questionsData.title: ? Where were brown and green colors seen
questionsData.article: Early humans watched their fires blacken the ceilings of the caves where they lived. They saw blue ,and red in the sky and brown and green on the ground. In time people began to understand that color not only made the world more beautiful, it was also able to convey emotions and symbolize power. Using colors they extracted from insects, plants and minerals, primitive humans copied animals , painting their bodies to signal aggression toward an enemy or to attract a mate. Over the centuries, the source of colors such as blue, purple, and red were carefully guarded and were often worth as much as gold. In the 19 ͭ ͪ century a young chemistry student became the first to manufacture a synthetic dye and suddenly the world become a much more colorful place. By the 20 ͭ ͪ century , as scientists discovered the psychological effects of colors, everyone from advertisers to educators found ways to make use of color to influence our feelings and behavior.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about ……….. inventors.
questionsData.article: When we think of famous inventors we usually think of men, people like Alexander Graham Bell and Thomas Edison. But, when we talk about many of things that make our life easier today, we find that they were invented by women. For example, the car was invented by a man, but a woman called Mary Anderson, who in 1903 solved one of the biggest problems of driving, invented windshield (wipers 1) to help the drivers to see when it is raining or snowing. In 1956, Bette Nesmith was working as a secretary. She used to make typing mistakes, then she had a brilliant idea, which was to use a white liquid to paint over mistakes. Her invention is called white-out. In 1966, Stephanie Kwolek invented Keverlar, a special material that was very light, but stronger than metal, this material is used to make bullet-proof vests to (protect 2) police officers, soldiers, and politicians all over the world.( Her 3) invention saved thousands of lives.

But, when we talk about many of things that make our life easier today, we find that they were invented by women. For example, the car was invented by a man, but a woman called Mary Anderson, who in 1903 solved one of the biggest problems of driving, invented windshield (wipers 1) to help the drivers to see when it is raining or snowing. In 1956, Bette Nesmith was working as a secretary. She used to make typing mistakes, then she had a brilliant idea, which was to use a white liquid to paint over mistakes. Her invention is called white-out. In 1966, Stephanie Kwolek invented Keverlar, a special material that was very light, but stronger than metal, this material is used to make bullet-proof vests to (protect 2) police officers, soldiers, and politicians all over the world.( Her 3) invention saved thousands of lives.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about
questionsData.article: Sea turtles are reptiles remarkably suited to life in sea. Their shape, large size, and (powerful 1) front flippers allow them to dive to great depths, and swim long distances. Although sea turtles can remain submerged for hours at a time while resting or sleeping, they typically surface several times each hour to breathe. In most sea turtles, the top shell is composed of many bones covered with horny scales. Unlike their terrestrial relatives, they cannot pull their heads into their shells. Most sea turtles grow slowly and have a lifespan of many decades. In summer reproduction begins when the female leaves the sea and crawls ashore to dig a nest in the sand, then deposits 80 to 150 eggs. The temperature of sea turtle nests determines the sex of the hatching. Warmer temperatures, produce more (female 2), whereas cooler temperatures result in more males. For this reason, wildlife managers leave turtle eggs in (their 3) original location whenever possible so that sex ratios are determined naturally.

questionsData.title: what's the closest relative to the alpaca?
questionsData.article: Alpacas , south American mammals , are in the same family as camels , llamas ,vicunas and guanacos . However , alpacas and llamas are closely related and they can successfully crossbreed. Alpacas are distinguished from llamas by their smaller size . The alpaca also differs from the llama in having a rounded body and in its shaggy fiber coat ,which differs from camel's hair and llama's wool coverings. An adult alpaca stands approximately 90cm (35inches) high and weighs 65kg (121 pounds) . The fiber of the alpaca is used for making wide variety of textiles . Alpacas are expert spitters , when they feel threatened , they spit slimy saliva , which is the acidic stomach contains , and project onto the chosentarget .

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about Robert Boyle’s ............
questionsData.article: The Anglo-Irish scientist Robert Boyle began as an alchemist and became the first modern chemist. He was born in Ireland in 1627.He studied philosophy and mathematics in England, Afterwards, he traveled in France and Italy then he taught at Oxford University. At first he believed in alchemy, but soon he started to think differently, He began to study substances more scientifically. In the late 1650s, he discovered elements or the basic substances that things are made of. This discovery opened the way for modern chemistry’.In 1662, Boyle made another important invention, now called Boyle’s law or gas law, which states that the pressure and volume of a gas have an inverse relationship. If the volume increases, the pressure decreases and vice versa. In his later years, Boyle was mostly interested in philosophy and religion, He died in 1691.

questionsData.title: The results of the transmission were…..
questionsData.article: In September 1994, a violent disease erupted among a group of race horses in a small town in Australia. The first victim was a female horse that was last seen eating grass beneath a fruit tree. One of her caretakers brought the animal back to her stable for observation, but the horse died two days later. Within two weeks, most of the other horses in the stable become ill as well. Despite the efforts by the veterinarian, 12more animals died. Laboratory analysis finally discovered the root of the problem: the horses had been infected by a previously unknown virus which doctors eventually labeled Hendra. This virus had originated in bats that lived in the tree where the first horse had been eating grass. The virus passed from the bats to the horse, Which then transbalited the virus to other horses with disastrons results.

Diamond is a form of pure carbon, transparent, colorless crystals. It may (occur 1) in different coloured forms
owing to presence of some melted oxide, which gives the colouration of several colors red, yellow, green, blue, or
black to the diamond. It could be found in the nature as (irregular 2) pieces. Diamond is brilliant when it’s
polished and smoothed for jewels manufacturing purposes. It is formed in the nature through crystallization of the
carbon underground by the influence of extreme heat and pressure. Diamond is the hardest substance known in the
nature. It is used to scratching and cutting other jewels and to polish (them 3). Diamond shows very high melting
point (about 3500 C). It is a bad conductor of electricity. It is a good conductor of heat because the electrons in the
bonds are shared and hence the heat can be dissipated easily. When a beam of light is directed to its faces, it
scattered and emitted as flashes in different direction, giving the diamond it’s brilliance and shining.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about ……….
questionsData.article: Pedicab is a small cab that is pulled by a bicycle. It has been (popular 2) in Asian countries for many years. These pedicabs do not take the place of taxis because people use them mainly just for short rides. The passengers of pedicabs are often people who do not want to walk because they are well-dressed for an evening event. Tourists also take them as a fun and an unusual way to get around the (city 1). The drivers of pedicabs are usually friendly students with strong legs. (They 3) pay the owner of the pedicabs a certain amount to use one for a day or evening. Any money they earn from passengers above the amount is their own. Typically, a pedicab driver earns about as much as he or she would earn by working in a restaurant. However, students who have chosen pedicabs say they prefer this kind of work. It may be more tiring, but they enjoy being out-door. They also like the fact that no one is telling them what to do.

questionsData.title: ? In which type of eclipses the Sun is covered completely
questionsData.article: A solar eclipse occurs when the Moon moves in front of the Sun and hides at least some part of the Sun from the Earth. In a partial eclipse, the Moon covers part of the Sun. In an annular eclipse, the Moon covers the center of the Sun, leaving a bright ring of light around the Moon. In a total eclipse, the Sun is completely covered by the Moon. It seems rather improbable that a celestial body the size of the Moon could completely block out the tremendously immense Sun, as happens during a total eclipse, but this is exactly what happens. Although the Moon is considerably smaller in size than the Sun, the Moon is able to cover the Sun because of their relative distances from the Earth. A total eclipse can last up to 7 minutes, during which time the Moon's shadow moves across the Earth ata rate of about 6 kilometers

A total eclipse can last up to 7 minutes, during which time the Moon's shadow moves across the Earth ata rate of about 6 kilometers
